trans-unit.source: Two-Class Bayes Point Machine
trans-unit.target: Two-Class Bayes Point Machine

trans-unit.source: Creates a Bayes point machine binary classification model
trans-unit.target: Creates a Bayes point machine binary classification model

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="0D90DCAB-08E1-4A66-9EA1-B571C22AE74D" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Initialize Model / Classification</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="0D90DCAB-08E1-4A66-9EA1-B571C22AE74D" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Initialize Model / Classification</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Two-Class Bayes Point Machine</ui> module to create an untrained binary classification model.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Two-Class Bayes Point Machine</ui> module to create an untrained binary classification model.

trans-unit.source: After you have configured the model, you must train the model on a labeled dataset using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.
trans-unit.target: After you have configured the model, you must train the model on a labeled dataset using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.

trans-unit.source: You can then pass the trained model to the <link xlink:href="401b4f92-e724-4d5a-be81-d5b0ff9bdb33" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Score Model</link> module to make predictions.
trans-unit.target: You can then pass the trained model to the <link xlink:href="401b4f92-e724-4d5a-be81-d5b0ff9bdb33" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Score Model</link> module to make predictions.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, the untrained model can be passed to <link xlink:href="75fb875d-6b86-4d46-8bcc-74261ade5826" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Cross Validate Model</link> for cross-validation against a labeled data set.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, the untrained model can be passed to <link xlink:href="75fb875d-6b86-4d46-8bcc-74261ade5826" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Cross Validate Model</link> for cross-validation against a labeled data set.

trans-unit.source: Understanding Bayes Point Machines
trans-unit.target: Understanding Bayes Point Machines

trans-unit.source: The Bayes Point Machine is a Bayesian approach to linear classification.
trans-unit.target: The Bayes Point Machine is a Bayesian approach to linear classification.

trans-unit.source: It efficiently approximates the theoretically optimal Bayesian average of linear classifiers (in terms of generalization performance) by choosing one "average" classifier, the Bayes Point.
trans-unit.target: It efficiently approximates the theoretically optimal Bayesian average of linear classifiers (in terms of generalization performance) by choosing one "average" classifier, the Bayes Point.

trans-unit.source: Because the Bayes Point Machine is a Bayesian classification model, it is not prone to overfitting to the training data.
trans-unit.target: Because the Bayes Point Machine is a Bayesian classification model, it is not prone to overfitting to the training data.

trans-unit.source: For more information, read the original research paper: <externalLink><linkText>Bayes Point Machines</linkText><linkUri>http://research.microsoft.com/apps/pubs/default.aspx?id=65611</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, read the original research paper: <externalLink><linkText>Bayes Point Machines</linkText><linkUri>http://research.microsoft.com/apps/pubs/default.aspx?id=65611</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: This implementation improves on the original algorithm in several ways:
trans-unit.target: This implementation improves on the original algorithm in several ways:

trans-unit.source: It uses the expectation propagation message-passing algorithm.
trans-unit.target: It uses the expectation propagation message-passing algorithm.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>A family of algorithms for approximate Bayesian inference</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=511015</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>A family of algorithms for approximate Bayesian inference</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=511015</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: It does not require parameter sweeping.
trans-unit.target: It does not require parameter sweeping.

trans-unit.source: It does not require data to be normalized.
trans-unit.target: It does not require data to be normalized.

trans-unit.source: These improvements make the Bayes Point Machine classification model more robust and easier-to-use, and you can bypass the time-consuming step of parameter tuning.
trans-unit.target: These improvements make the Bayes Point Machine classification model more robust and easier-to-use, and you can bypass the time-consuming step of parameter tuning.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see Chris Bishop's post on the Microsoft Machine Learning blog: <externalLink><linkText>Embracing Uncertainty - Probabilistic Inference</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.technet.com/b/machinelearning/archive/2014/10/30/embracing-uncertainty-probabilistic-inference.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>,
trans-unit.target: For more information, see Chris Bishop's post on the Microsoft Machine Learning blog: <externalLink><linkText>Embracing Uncertainty - Probabilistic Inference</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.technet.com/b/machinelearning/archive/2014/10/30/embracing-uncertainty-probabilistic-inference.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>,

trans-unit.source: How to Configure the Two-Class Bayes Point Machine
trans-unit.target: How to Configure the Two-Class Bayes Point Machine

trans-unit.source: You can use the following parameters to customize the behavior of the Bayes Point Machine algorithm:
trans-unit.target: You can use the following parameters to customize the behavior of the Bayes Point Machine algorithm:

trans-unit.source: Number of training iterations
trans-unit.target: Number of training iterations

trans-unit.source: Type a number to specify how often the message-passing algorithm iterates over the training data.
trans-unit.target: Type a number to specify how often the message-passing algorithm iterates over the training data.

trans-unit.source: The higher the number of training iterations, the more accurate the predictions; however, training will be slower.
trans-unit.target: The higher the number of training iterations, the more accurate the predictions; however, training will be slower.

trans-unit.source: For most datasets, the default setting of 30 training iterations is sufficient for the algorithm to make accurate predictions.
trans-unit.target: For most datasets, the default setting of 30 training iterations is sufficient for the algorithm to make accurate predictions.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes accurate predictions can be made by using fewer iterations.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes accurate predictions can be made by using fewer iterations.

trans-unit.source: For datasets with highly correlated features, you might benefit from more training iterations.
trans-unit.target: For datasets with highly correlated features, you might benefit from more training iterations.

trans-unit.source: Typically, the number of iterations should be set to a value in the range 5 – 100.
trans-unit.target: Typically, the number of iterations should be set to a value in the range 5 – 100.

trans-unit.source: Include bias
trans-unit.target: Include bias

trans-unit.source: Select this option if you want a constant feature or bias to be added to each instance in training and prediction.
trans-unit.target: Select this option if you want a constant feature or bias to be added to each instance in training and prediction.

trans-unit.source: Including a bias is necessary when the data does not already contain a constant feature.
trans-unit.target: Including a bias is necessary when the data does not already contain a constant feature.

trans-unit.source: Allow unknown values
trans-unit.target: Allow unknown values

trans-unit.source: Select this option to create a group for unknown values.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to create a group for unknown values.

trans-unit.source: If you deselect it, the model can accept only the values that are contained in the training data.
trans-unit.target: If you deselect it, the model can accept only the values that are contained in the training data.

trans-unit.source: In the former case, the model might be less precise for known values, but it can provide better predictions for new (unknown) values.
trans-unit.target: In the former case, the model might be less precise for known values, but it can provide better predictions for new (unknown) values.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: To see how the Bayes Point Machine is used in machine learning, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: To see how the Bayes Point Machine is used in machine learning, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Compare Binary Classifiers</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525729</linkUri></externalLink> sample demonstrates the use of various two-class classifiers.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Compare Binary Classifiers</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525729</linkUri></externalLink> sample demonstrates the use of various two-class classifiers.
